text: Antonina Wyrzykowska née Karwowska (born 12 August 1916 in Janczewko; died 29 November 2011 in Milanówek) was a Polish Righteous Among the Nations known for helping Jews who fled the Jedwabne pogrom.Antonina Wyrzykowska – her activity to save Jews' lives during the Holocaust, at Yad Vashem website She was also decorated with the Commander's Cross of the Order of Polonia Restituta by Poland's President Lech Kaczyński. Her husband, Aleksander Wyrzykowski, was also honoured as Righteous Among the Nations.Aleksander Wyrzykowski at Yad Vashem website == References == ==External links== * Jedwabne – A Noble Family in the Midst of Murder and Betrayal: Aleksander & Antonina Wyrzykowski, at Yad Vashem website Category:Polish Righteous Among the Nations Category:People from Łomża County Category:1916 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Commanders of the Order of Polonia Restituta
title: Antonina Wyrzykowska
